contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox single | Name = Queen of the Reich | Cover = Queensryche - Queen of the Reich cover.jpg | Artist = [[Queensrÿche]] | Album = [[Queensrÿche (EP)|Queensrÿche]] | B-side = "The Lady Wore Black" | Released = 1984 | Format = [[CD single]], [[Gramophone record|Vinyl]] | Recorded = Triad Studios, <br />[[Redmond, Washington]]<br>late summer, 1982 | Genre = [[Heavy metal music|Heavy metal]], [[power metal]] | Length = 4:24 | Label = [[EMI America Records]] | Producer = [[Neil Kernon]] & [[Queensrÿche]] | Writer = Music & Lyrics: [[Chris DeGarmo]] | | Last single = | This single = "'''Queen of the Reich'''"<br/>(1984) | Next single = "[[Take Hold of the Flame]]"<br/>(1984) | Misc = {{Extra track listing | Album = [[Queensrÿche (EP)|Queensrÿche]] | Type = single | prev_track = | prev_no = | this_track = "'''Queen of the Reich'''" | track_no = 1 | next_track = "Nightrider" | next_no = 2 }}{{ Extra music sample | filename = Queensryche - Queen of the Reich.ogg | format = [[Ogg]] | title = "Queen of the Reich" | type = single }} }} '''"Queen of the Reich"''' is a heavy metal song first recorded in 1981 for a demo tape by "The Mob", later known as [[Queensrÿche]]. "Queen of the Reich" was first recorded on ''[[Queensrÿche (EP)|Queensrÿche]]'' (aka ''Queensrÿche EP'') along with "The Lady Wore Black", "Nightrider", and "Blinded". The band actually had a bit of trouble getting [[Geoff Tate]] (their former singer) to sing, since he already had a band as well.{{Citation needed|date=January 2012}} The song is also featured in ''[[Grand Theft Auto: Vice City Stories]]'' This song was also the basis for the band's new name. The spelling was altered from "Queensreich" to avoid connotations with [[Nazi Germany]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.faqs.org/faqs/music/queensryche-faq/ |title=MUSIC: Queensryche FAQ |publisher=Faqs.org |date= |accessdate=2010-07-31}}</ref> [[Chris Collins (singer)|Chris Collins]], the first vocalist of the progressive metal band [[Dream Theater]], covered this song for his audition for the band. The British band [[Shadowkeep]] covered this song on the compilation album ''Rebellion - A Tribute to [[Queensrÿche]]'', released on [[CMH Records|Dwell Records]] in 2000. Japanese power metal band [[Galneryus]] covered this song for their 2010 cover album, ''Voices from the Past III''. ==Chart performance== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="margin:0 1em 1em 0;" |- !Chart !Peak !class=unsortable| |- ||{{flagicon|UK}} [[UK Singles Chart|UK Singles]] ||align=center|94 ||<ref>[http://www.chartstats.com/artistinfo.php?id=3924], an archive containing all UK charts for [[Queensrÿche]]</ref> |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Queensrÿche}} [[Category:1983 songs]] [[Category:1984 singles]] [[Category:Queensrÿche songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Chris DeGarmo]]
